Definition.WordDefinition: slog v 1: work doggedly or persistently; "She keeps plugging away at her dissertation" [syn: {plug away}, {peg away}, {keep one's nose to the grindstone}, {keep one's shoulder to the wheel}] 2: walk heavily and firmly, as when weary, or through mud; "Mules plodded in a circle around a grindstone" [syn: {footslog}, {plod}, {trudge}, {pad}, {tramp}] 3: strike heavily, especially with the fist or a bat; "He slugged me so hard that I passed out" [syn: {slug}, {swig}] [also: {slogging}, {slogged}]
